posts.message:
Dear Team Kirkstall - an update and thanks for 4 weeks of incredible work

We are in phase two of the cleanup & rebuild - please read and SHARE SHARE SHARE so folk can find out how to get involved, as we still need help to see this cleanup through and make the success a lasting story. 

It's still not a month since Kirkstall flooded and local people sprang into action in what has been hailed as an incredible success story by the everybody who has witnessed your awesome efforts during this cleanup.

Since opening the volunteer centre we have registered over 500 volunteers through the volunteer centre - with most folk returning again and again to help clean up Kirkstall road and get folk back on their feet as quickly as possible.  Now we are focusing on getting the final few properties and businesses clearer out, and turning out attention wholeheartedly on the rebuild, to help get Kirkstall back to its former glory before spring. 

The volunteer centre at Open Source Arts is still open and this week we will be continuing to welcome volunteers, register them, kit them out and send them into the community to help those most in need. 

The big projects for this week are the community assets like the Milford rugby club who need their changing rooms and communal areas cleaning out, the burley wood allotments whicvh have been covered in detritus and the banks of the river which are still needing a giant litter pick - much clearing of washed up rubbish remains to be done so please text the following numbers if you have time to spare - 

Phil - 07508543473
Lucy - 07989503814
Freya - 07588547040

let us know your name (if you havent been in touch before) - as well as what days and times you are free so we can schedule in groups and plan where they will go. 

there are lots more ways for folk to get involved if you don't fancy getting mucky with manual work - here are some of the things we also need: 

Administrators and Telephone helpers - 

Both to manage the volunteer desk at Open Source Arts and also to help with the MAMMOTH task of phoning round all the businesses and donors who have pledged help which now need following up and turning into actual delivered donations!  folk have been very kind but memory fades and we need folk to help with phoning up to finalise the offers and schedule in times for the kind donations of building materials and rebuild stock to be delivered to our temporary storage warehouse which has kindly been donated by Simon at Cardigan Mills trading estate -  which ushers in the next role:

We need Van drivers or folk with estate cars - 

To help with the collection and transportation of donations to the new storage space - as well as helping take some of the domestic donations to partner charities like Yorkshire Aid, who are ready now to accept our surplus donations of clothes and household kit.  they are going to take responsibility for disseminating those surplus donations to either homeless people or refugee and asylum seekers who REALLY need them right now.  all donations which folk have kindly given will get to people who really need them - even if they dont go to folk directly affected by the flooding. 

We need Film Crew!

All this week we have had film crews out on Kirkstall Rd gathering footage and recording the story of the price this community has paid to the flood water - ensuring that as the media ceases to cover the story the true extent is not forgotten.  Folk are still working tirelessly to rebuild their livelihoods and we want to make sure the story of their efforts are heard not just locally but also by the decision makers down at the end of the M1 - so PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE if you have  passion for tech and want to get handy with a camera taking video or still photos, or if you are an emotionally intelligent person who can ask the right questions to make people feel safe to tell their story fully for the camera, please get in touch on the numbers above.

We have already collected a great deal of footage which will be hitting the new Kirkstall Cleanup YouTube channel this coming week - but beyond that, we want to collect sufficient footage over a prolonged period of time to create a feature length documentary showing the full story to those who need to know (and those who want to learn). Please get involved.

We need passionate community organisers to join our events committee

Springing from this incredible story, a story built of your outstanding donations of time and energy is a growing legacy for Kirkstall - and we will shortly be rebranding to Team Kirkstall and this means a great excuse for parties, celebrations, events and meetings within this outstanding community.  

We are appealing for people of all ages to join the events committee to help us create events for the whole community - starting with a MASSIVE THANK YOU PARTY - to celebrate the work everybody has put in. 

This is only the beginning, and we are gathering momentum.  We want to create regular opportunities for everybody from this outstanding community to come together to celebrate the skills, talents and eccentricities native in the area - and find new ways to share ideas about how to make the community stronger, more resilient, quicker to organise and more able to make it's wishes heard and dreams come true for the people who live here.  Please come and join us to build the community you want to live in. 

We need folk willing to join the response team - 

Following on from this cleanup we have been given a shipping container which we will store the response kit in - and working in partnership with The Environment Agency and Leeds City Council we will be running a programme of workshops for folk wishing to learn the volunteer management skills and the flood response skills necessary to respond quickly when something like this (not specifically as flood event, but anything which necessitates the community to rally around) happens in the future.  if you want to be a flood warden or general community responder, watch this space for information on how you can join the team, get skilled up and be on call for when we might have to dust off the head torches and brooms in the future.  

The hunt for tradespeople continues:

This is your opportunity to dig deep into your contacts list and think of a willing tradesperson who you think might want to donate some of their time to help the worst affected folk rebuild their livelihoods quickly - we want you to tag plumbers, electricians, builders, plasterers, tilers, joiners and landscapers who can donate a day of their time to the tradesperson timebank - lets rebuild kirkstall in style.

This is all creating a wonderful tapestry, one which is echoing through Leeds and teaching subtle lessons to many about how a community can come together in its time of need - so lets take it to the next level and make the story a lasting, vibrant legacy by seeing this through in true Team Kirkstall style.  

So, if you feel like you have time, we definitely have a way for you to get involved - please get in touch on the numbers above and SHARE SHARE SHARE and TAG anyone who you think could give their skills and time to this effort - so that when we ge tto the thank you party we all have something to thank each other for. 

Thank you all for the time, energy, enthusiasm and dedication 

Each and every person who has dedicated time is an inspiration and I thank you from the depths of my flood riddled existence. 

Looking forward to what is to come, 

Thank you!

Phil

posts.message:
Dear Team Kirkstall - Exciting news about the video diary project - please Read and SHARE SHARE SHARE!

I've had a couple of interesting conversations today with Craig and Lucas (two experienced filmmakers) and we have augmented the plan for how to make the video diary / documentary.

This means that as well as having a diary room set up in the volunteer centre at open source arts, we are also going to skill up any volunteers who want to help go out into the community to record the community stories.

In order to do this, Craig will be running 2 x "how to shoot, edit and upload a short video" at the workshop on Tuesday - for ALL VOLUNTEERS wishing to learn how to make a short video.  This is a great opportunity for volunteers to skill up and learn how to shoot a short video, edit it add credits and music and upload it to youtube all on an ipad - from a really skilled teacher who typically teaches professional television journalists how to make similar videos for news programmes. 

To book your place on this training course reply below, they will be running on Tuesday 12th January - one at 12 noon and one at 1.30pm. 10 places per course.

The footage which our roving volunteer film makers collect will be uploaded directly to a new youtube channel so we can start to record the true emotional component behind this flooding, how it has affected people on a personal level. 

The videos will be used to tell the true stories to decision makers hundreds of miles away, to help the lobbying process to try and get Leeds prioritised for improvements to the flood defences and attempt to gain the proper amount of funding to help the community recover and become more resilient.  

When all the stories are collated, we will edit them together into a feature length documentary which we will try and get into the Leeds International Film Festival in the autumn. 

How cool would that be - Team Kirkstall in the film festival!!!! Let's get on it pronto and make it happen in the same way we've made this cleanup happen!

Please share this and tag anyone you think would be interested in learning to make these short films, learning how to interview for camera, learning how to edit video or learning how to put it all together into the feature length - this is going to be a project form the community, about the community, delivered by members of the community and therefore if you want to be involved, there is a job waiting for you - GET IN TOUCH NOW!

Thanks for all your dedication up to this point - now lets take the story to the people who need to hear it!

Phil

Hello Team Kirkstall !!

In light of our EXCELLENT progress, we are changing the way we manage the volunteers so please read and SHARE SHARE SHARE this post so the message spreads. 

What an excellent week it's been! The continued influx of volunteers has seriously blown me away - and together we have been blasting through the jobs list - continuing to gut, clear, sort and de filth the businesses all along Kirkstall road. 

Most businesses have by this stage had the loss adjusters in from their insurance companies, so we can begin clearing out these final buildings - so we really feel like we are entering the home straight with the clearouts.  This means that if you have a business which has been affected and you need our help you have to get in touch swifty if you want a volunteer team to come down and help - as we will close the volunteer centre and stop appealing for volunteers when there are no more registered jobs to complete.  

With this in mind, we have modified the volunteer management system so that volunteers now need no longer turn up at 11am each morning for registering, but rather now we are booking people who want to help into a time-slot so they can be matched up with a waiting job!

so, IF YOU WANT TO VOLUNTEER:

1.  Text Lucy (07989 503814) or Freya (07588 547 040) and detail your availability on each day in the coming week - they will then reply with a what days and hours youve been slotted into.  
2.  Come to the volunteer centre on the days/times youve been texted about and you will be allocated your jobs and kitted out - put in your team and then sent out to save the universe.  
3.  come back, have a cuppa and hopefully get involved in our new video diary project (More info about that tomorrow) 

It's fairly simple, but it means we are in stage two of the cleanup and it feels like we are making good headway.  Lets keep the momentum going so that we can really finish this job in style and start on the rebuilding effort earnestly.

Today all the business owners on kirkstall road met with representatives from the council, including Racheal Reeves, Tom Rioirdan, Cllrs Lucinda Yeadon and John Illingworth, plus representatives from the environment agency, Leeds Economic Partnership, Association of British Insurers and the Leeds Chamber of Commerce. 

It was a good meeting and hopefully folk felt heard, even if the offers of initial relief grants of £2500 are seemingly insignificant, the council would like to encourage everybody to apply and register the entire extent of their losses, so that the true cost of this event can be totalled up for the purposes of lobbying for better flood defences, going forward.

The meeting was successful in telling business owners what kinds of support were available form the council and making sure business owners knew how to apply.  

For anyone who has not received the forms of needs more information - the forms are in the documents section of the facebook group - please click the "files" section at the top of the page to access them.  

We are still calling out for TRADESPEOPLE who want to donate their time to the cleanup - please email the group if you'd like to sign up, and if you know someone who could donate their time, please tag them in this post so they get the opportunity to help out.  

We can offer exposure by us publicising your business or trading name via our web portals and social media, and by listing your information on our facebook page under contacts - and in return you can help us rebuild this community bigger and stronger than it was before! 

Finally, Open Source Arts are going to be doing a story collecting exercise for the next fortnight, and we want everybody who has been effected by the flooding to come and tell us their story - we will be opening a video diary room on monday and you can book a time slot to come and tell us your story by texting lucy/freya your availability and they reply with what slot you can come to the volunteer centre to record your story during.  

It's MEGA IMPORTANT to record the stories of everybody effected now, so that in one month, 6 months or 3 years... whatever time in the future, the true emotional story of this flooding continues to resonate with the people who make the decisions, and the effects are not forgotten - so PLEASE TELL US YOUR STORY.  

We want to hear from everybody involved, not only people who were involved in the cleanup - we want business owners, rescue services, the police, councillors, the fire brigade, council officers, residents, dog walkers, scrap metal collectors - EVERYBODY!  Come and tell us what it's been like for you so we can get the broadest picture possible and really tell the true story!

Thank you EVERYBODY once again, this story is unfolding to create a much broader story for the Kirkstall community and it really really feels like we have a golden opportunity to emerge from this as a well networked, vibrant, active community ready to act of it's own volition to create a stronger community.  

You're all inspirational, 

Thank you so so much!  

Phil and all the team at the volunteer centre

posts.message:
TUESDAY 6th JANUARY UPDATE

Dear Kirkstall Cleaners - what a day it's been.  Thank you all to everyone who has turned out so far along the way - and extra special thanks to everyone who has continued their enthusiasm and dedication to carry on volunteering their valuable time into the new year.  I know a lot of you have started back at work and life carries on, so for all the time you gave, THANK YOU SO MUCH!

For everyone else who is CONTINUING to come, day after day, you are responsible for a growing total of volunteer hours.  Since we opened the volunteer centre on 28th December, we have registered an astonishing total of over 400 new volunteers - which does not include any of the hundreds of volunteers who turned out in force in the first few days after the flooding initially hit.  

Figuring very conservatively - we calculate that this equals at least 2500 Volunteer hours, but that only reckons that each person who came down each day has given three hours and most people have given SO MUCH MORE!  arriving at 10am to the volunteer centre and not leaving until well after dark!  It's AWESOME and INSPIRING! it's a staggering amount of time and has been instrumental in the success story that has been this #KirkstallCleanup  ! 

We have had a great day today down the volunteer centre, at @Opensourcearts with 40 volunteers registering and heading out to get stuck in, mucking out and gutting dark cellars and finally getting an opportunity to clean and make things look right again.  

Our long travelling volunteers, the guys form T2T (Tunnels 2 towers) came through again today, as well as helpers from international Aid response Team israAID. They have many an interesting story and THE BEST cardamom coffee - it's like rocket fuel which explains how they manage to crack on so swiftly amidst the seas of destruction.  

This volunteer effort is astounding and we are beginning to make sense of the struggle - the effort is entering its second phase and I am focusing all my energy on building a great database of trades professionals who are willing to donate one day of their time, which will then be brokered out to uninsured individuals and businesses to help them get their feet beneath them again.  

So if you are a carpenter / joiner, plumber, gas engineer, painter and decorator, landscaper, metal worker, electrician then PLEASE GET IN TOUCH or SHARE SHARE SHARE and TAG people who you know might be able to help out.  This is the link to the form that you should fill in to register your offers of help.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1rA_oMZN1w_WpTKOnijl1SQM-ptmj2KwrwzonpJkctv8/viewform 

Please help us make this rebuild Kirkstall effort as successful as the cleanup Kirkstall effort.  

in the next week we will be looking at local resilience provision - which means putting essential kit which we have sourced (sandbags, lighting, shovels, brushes etc.) into a shipping container and plonking it somewhere in Kirkstall locally so that local people can respond to significant floor risks quickly, on the ground, without waiting for the powers that be to get their act in gear!  

We will also be providing training for anyone interested on key things like laying out sand bags, mobilising volunteers etc. so - if you want to learn more, come in to find out about our plan and how you can become involved in the response phone tree.  

Timeframes

We are going to be running the Volunteer centre here for the next fortnight, during which time we hope to have completed the cleanup and got businesses to the point where they are ready to start refitting and for the people living and working here to rebuild their lives.  

With this in mind, I'd really like to encourage all the businesses who have been affected to come to the meeting with the council at Viva Cuba this Friday at 9.30am -  it's an opportunity to ask any questions about the government flood relief programme which is being devised, and to find out how to apply.  It will also be an opportunity to register your needs for help and rebuild time - so please come and get all the help you can. 

We are closing on Sunday to give our volunteers a day off, as they have been working flat out since day 1 and deserve a rest so the next week can be tackled enthusiastically and effectively.  

Tomorrow, Friday and Saturday we have lots of jobs still to complete, so volunteers are very much required - we need lifters, carriers, cleaners, donations sorters, cooks, van drivers, people who can use pressure washers, folk who want to do some admin and people to help run the sign in desk at the volunteer centre... so they're is most likely a job for you if you have even a couple of hours to spare - COME ON DOWN and get stuck into being park of #TeamKirkstall.

Thank you all, for everything we have achieved together in the last ten day, you are all inspirational and it's an absolute privilege to be co-creating this with you all. 

Phil
Please SHARE SHARE SHARE far and wide everybody this is our big mission for the coming week!  Let's get busy and #RebuildKirkstall!!

posts.message:
Good ladies and kind gentlefolk of Kirkstall, 

Please SHARE SHARE SHARE - we have a lot left to do and volunteers are NEEDED!

This is the start of week two of our incredible #KirkstallCleanup operation - and thank you, each and every one for continuing day after day to work like human sized two legged donkeys with hands and feet to get this community back in action.

We have ushered in the new year, and I'm not just celebrating because its the new year, I'm celebrating because of the incredible movement of volunteers working together in good humoured unison that I've witnessed over the last week.

Each day we have been working from the Volunteer centre at Open Source Arts - welcoming volunteers, registering them, kitting them out and sending them where they are needed - and our volunteers are reporting that the volunteering experience is an excellent one.  We have had many lovely comments about how well held, supported and looked after the volunteers feel, and how important this is to making the cleanup a swifter process.  Not all disasters have to feel disastrous until they have been completely dealt with - and this effort is testament to that - so THANK YOU ALL for your positivity and dedication!  You are the ones making this the massive success it is.

Today we were on hand as the second wave of businesses returned from their christmas holidays and found the devastation caused by the floodwater - We have been helping them clean out all day and are expecting more requests for help over the coming week.  

A lot of mucking out, a lot of damaged stock and a lot of sweeping and brushing and mopping - but together we can do it rapidly - so please like and share this post to make sure we can carry on this incredible volunteer effort right to the conclusion. 

We are expanding our focus this week - and putting in place efforts to #RebuildKirkstall 

Therefore we want to hear form skilled tradespeople who are willing to donate one or more days of their time, which will be taken, compiled into a directory and then brokered out to the most needy residents and small traders who have no insurance and desperately need help to get their lives back on track.  so if you are a tradesperson, get in touch, or if you know a tradesperson who might give a day of their time, please TAG them in this post so they can get signed up and do their bit to help out.

If you want to get involved and help with the cleanup - come down to the volunteer centre at Open Source Arts and get registered, put in a team and kitted out to help finish the cleanup so we can start the rebuild in style.

An important date for all local traders is the meeting at 9.30am on Friday morning at Viva Cuba - so please SHARE this so business owners on Kirkstall can get themselves down to hear about what the council is saying about flood recovery for businesses on Kirkstall Road.

Thank you all once again for your time, enthusiasm, dedication, smiles, immunity to dampening of the spirit and all the terrible terrible jokes.

See you tomorrow and for the rest of the week 

Phil

Thank you Kirkstall - More Volunteers Needed
PLEASE SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!!

Overwhelming and inspiring responses to the flood cleanup are warming my heart - I'm so happy to see community spirit continuing into the new year as people continue to come to the Volunteer Centre at Open Source Arts to register their offers of help and requirements for assistance. 

If you are ready and willing to help us with the #KirkstallCleanup come down to the Volunteer Centre and get signed up on monday - Specific jobs which we REALLY need are: 

-  Capable Administrators to help share the workload of the volunteer co-ordinators (if you come down tomorrow we can give you a few hours training so will learn all the systems on a light day ready for the new influx next week.

-  Van drivers to help us start to distribute the donations we are receiving to the rest of the region 

-  Capable folk who are good on the telephone who are willing to do phone ring rounds for us on our sourcing team. we have the lists but we need a hardcore team of people with good patter ready to do the phone work - previous call centre or telephone customer services work would be a benefit!

Thank you all once again for being the most inspiring community i have had the joy of being part of - this is a landmark event and you are all part of it -

posts.message:
Tomorrow we talk to David Simon — creator of The Wire (!) — about politics and our civilizational problems. Safe to say he has some thoughts: "There’s going to be poor, there’s going to be rich. We are who we are, and the market argues for what it argues. But if everyone doesn’t feel like we share at least some sense of the same America and we’re all in some way responsible for the collective whole, this is going to be a coarse and brutish place."

So what do you want us to ask Mr. Simon tomorrow?
What the Queens-bound 7 train saw. Superfast, almost Gaspar Noé-ish (by Dj Hammers and via kottke.org).

Take a moment for Martin Luther King, Jr.'s state of the union, delivered late 1964 and now available via Nobel Prize:

"Another indication that progress is being made is found in the recent presidential election in the United States. The American people revealed great maturity by overwhelmingly rejecting a presidential candidate who had become identified with extremism, racism, and retrogression. The voters of our nation rendered a telling blow to the radical right. They defeated those elements in our society which seek to pit white against negro and lead the nation down a dangerous, fascist path. Now let me not leave you with a false impression. The problem is far from solved. We still have a long, long way to go before the dream of freedom is a reality for the negro in the United States."

#martinlutherking #mlk

Friends, rebels, Mary Beard fans: we're going on WBUR 90.9 FM at 9pm ET tonight. 

We'll take the Rome story from Beard's latest book, SPQR. And then we'll ask classicist Kathleen Coleman and her one-time student, the agitator/critic Chris Hedges, to connect the dots: inside the Roman soul and between their empire and its American descendant. 

http://radioopensource.org/empire-to-empire/

You could lead off by watching part one of the BBC special, Meet the Romans with Mary Beard!
One thing you can't do on the radio — this kind of high-level film talk by Max Tohline. (via kottke.org; see also Every Frame a Painting, right now, if you're a film buff.)

We're recording RIGHT NOW with Mary Beard, your favorite BBC America classicist and author of the new Rome history S.P.Q.R.

Tell us your questions for Prof Beard and what you want to learn about the Romans this week on the radio!

An event organized by members of Open Source Community Cluj with the help of Friends Cafe

Last night 3 of our members organized an event for all the people passionate about software development, here in Cluj-Napoca.

Adina Lazar, Robert Vacareanu and Prodan Tudor represents the vision I had when I started this whole Open Source movement. They showed us that everything is possible if you really want that. 
I can’t find the words to describe how proud of them I am. I was so excited during the event preparation and they showed us all their passion and leadership skills. When I think of last night, sentences like “Passion”, “Leadership through example”, “Team work”, “Inspire by doing” come into my mind.

Please join me in congratulating them! I know for sure that they will continue to inspire others and lead through example and this event was only the first step in that direction. I know that it was hard, difficult but they proved us all that it can happen. 

Tudor, Robert, Adina you are the leaders we need and for that we thank you!

Have an amazing day!
Ark

Jordan Open Source Association is working towards Open Data in Jordan, and our team members are demonstrating their expertise in this field.

Using Open Data, Riskopy and our Ahmad Sadeddin have launched a Software Vulnerability Research Platform, that will hold more than 80K vulnerabilities, 200K software versions and 4 million relationships.

كان لادوارد سنودن الفضل في الكشف عن حجم التجسس للولايات المتحدة على دول العالم. نفس الوثائق المسربة أظهرت أن المواطن الأردني كان من الأهداف المفضلة لدى الاستخبارات الأميركية.
شاهد الحلقة الجديدة من 8بت: إنتاج مشترك بين الجمعية الأردنية للمصدر المفتوح وتلفزيون الإنترنت عرمرم
In 2013, Edward Snowden disclosed secret documents that revealed NSA mass monitoring. Surprisingly, Jordanians were a main target of the US secret services.
ًWatch the new episode of 8bit, a production of Jordan Open Source Association and Aramram Web TV

يشير الباحث في الجمعية الأردنية للمصدر المفتوح، براء حسنية، إلى آفات في النفاذ إلى شبكة الإنترنت عربيًا. فبين مطرقة شركات الاتصالات الجشعة وسندان الحكومات اللامبالية، يقف المواطن العربي حائرا دون بدائل مجدية للاتصال بالإنترنت.
في مقالة نشرها موقع "حبر" هذا الأسبوع، يسلّط حسنية الضوء على عدد من الحلول الممكنة لمدّ البنى التحتية للإنترنت وتعزيزها، وذلك لإيصال الإنترنت إلى شريحة أكبر من المواطنين وبتكلفة منخفضة:

ثلاث سنوات مضت على فقداننا آرون سوارتز؛ تستذكر جمعيتنا اليوم واحدًا من ألمع مبرمجي الحاسوب وأحد أشجع أقطاب حقوق الإنترنت. تمكن سوارتز، بهمة لا تعرف الكلل، من ابتكار تقنية RSS والمساهمة في نشر المشاع الإبداعي والمصدر المفتوح، بل أمسى يدافع عن الحقوق الرقمية عامة، والعمل لمناهضة مخاطر اتفاقية SOPA الشهيرة. كل ذلك في فترة وجيزة من حياته التي لم تدم طويلًا.
في هذه الذكرى نستشعر مكانته، آملين العمل بذات المبادئ التي سار عليها في نشر المعرفة رقميا بلا حدود أو قيود.

While fast Internet has been declared a legal right for citizens in some countries like Finland, Internet users in Jordan are dissatisfied with Internet speed and the poor quality of service.
Gamers face these issues on a daily basis, however, a slow Internet doesn't affect only gaming and surfing, it has a negative impact on the Jordanian economy with an estimated loss of hundreds of millions annually.

في وقت اعتبرت بعض الدول الإنترنت السريع حقا من حقوقا مواطنيها، يعاني مستخدمو الإنترنت في الأردن كثيرا من البطء ورداءة الخدمة التي يحصلون عليها.
ومثل غيرهم من المواطنين، يواجه لاعبو الألعاب الإلكترونية هذه المشكلة كل يوم. بالطبع لا تؤثر سرعة الإنترنت على اللعب والتصفح فقط، بل لها تأثير على الناتج الإجمالي للأردن بما يقدر بمئات الملايين سنويا.

تضرر الكثير من المواطنين من الأحداث الجوية الأخيرة في مناطق عديدة من المملكة، يهدف هذا التقرير إلى حصر هذه الخسائر في محاولة لفهم التأثيرات الجوية على البنية التحتية لمدننا.

إذا حدث لك ضرر صحّي أو مادّي بسبب الأمطار الأخيرة، شاركنا بقصتك عبر هذا الموقع.

Last week, we've organized a small experimental workshop with young ladies from Ruwwad | رواد التنمية and 2 other private and public schools. During the workshop, the young ladies have learned how to develop their own blog websites with Python and Django and put it live on the web in one day.

Thanks to our mentors who volunteered their time, knowledge and effort to support the community:
- Abdallah Nassif, Hamzeh Darwish, Ismail Abu Sameed, Ahmad Bazadough and Ibrahim Abu Hijleh from Semantic Intelligent Technologies (SIT)
- Diana Nasser from Souq.com 
- Hamzeh Sharawi from Boundless Drop

Thanks to Zain Innovation Campus - ZINC for the continuous support and for providing the venue and the tasty food.

And a big thanks goes to Django Girls for making their workshop materials available to others and spreading the open source spirit.

That printing cars, guns, and cell phones is just around the corner. So much ignorance in that line of thought. Not to be insulting, but it's the best way to put it. Take a look at every Popular Science cover since 1900. Every other month it's "Flying cars will be in YOUR garage within a couple years!" Same kind of mentality is developing around 3D printers.

The technology is becoming popular day by day and the cost of printers are also falling down rapidly. This is high time to understand and take the advantages of this excellent technology.
So, to get an idea about this Mind-boggling and cool technology, we would welcome all of you to our workshop on 3D Printing presentation-cum-demonstration Workshop in Association with National Students' Space Challenge, powered by Srijan Creations, A Kolkata based 3D Printing Institute.

Oggi riprendiamo un articolo del 2014 scritto da Salvatore Iaconesi & Oriana Persico (di AOS - Art is Open Source) per CheFuturo! 

"Per dirlo con Marx: quel che si muove nel nostro cervello è un prodotto della società. L’industrializzazione della mente (e nella mente) è un processo degli ultimi cento anni. E non può essere spiegato semplicemente attraverso l’analisi delle sue tecnologie. Il termine, vago e poco preciso, dell’industria culturale incarna un paradosso. La coscienza può essere indotta e riprodotta industrialmente, ma non può essere prodotta. È un prodotto sociale: la sua natura è nel dialogo. Nessun processo industriale può sostituire le persone che lo generano. L’industria della mente non produce nulla, se non le dinamiche di infiltrazione e trasmissione necessarie alla formazione della percezione del possibile, desiderabile, preferibile: nella formazione della percezione di futuro".

http://www.chefuturo.it/2014/10/come-sopravvivere-alle-nuove-fabbriche-della-mente-proviamo-a-ripartire-dalla-scuola/

posts.message: Sono passati (solo) 24 anni.

Some people need to see to understand

This project was originally created to generate a picture (or map) of the Internet. Since the Internet is basically a vast constellation of networks that somehow interconnect to provide the relatively seamless communication of data, it seemed logical one could draw lines from one point to another. The visualization is a collection of programs that collectively output an image of every relationship of every network on the Internet.

The result was an award-winning representation of the Internet that now hangs in the Museum of Modern Art in NYC.

The idea turned into a 10+ year labor of love under the moniker of The Opte Project. The map has been used an icon of what the Internet looks like in hundreds of books, in movies, museums, office buildings, educational discussions, and countless publications. The map has also become a teaching tool, allowing people that are visual learners to quickly understand what the Internet and networking is about.

The images are released under a creative commons license, which allows anyone to use it for non-commercial purposes. For commercial use, there is a single one-time license fee which goes to support this project.

-> http://www.opte.org

"Per cambiare alcune situazioni dannose della società attuale occorre prima di tutto conoscere gli uomini, il cervello umano con le sue infinite funzioni e connessioni, e poi si può sperare di cambiare. Colpevolizzare colui che sbaglia senza conoscere i meccanismi biologici che governano l’uomo significa essere ignoranti, e l’ignoranza porta all’incomprensione, che porta alla paura, che porta al conflitto. Questo è il motivo per cui la cosa giusta da fare, in questo momento storico, è agire sull’apprendimento; smettere se non altro di criticare chi sbaglia, capirne le ragioni profonde e prevenire un futuro errore ma non solo: creare una possibilità di redenzione."

via ISIA Urbino

posts.message:
"Una ricerca del Career Advisory Board dell’Università DeVry documenta infatti come i millennials (e più precisamente la seconda ondata dei nati a partire dagli anni Novanta), abbiano del lavoro una concezione diametralmente opposta a quella della generazione che oggi occupa i posti dirigenziali. Se il 48% del campione dei seniores, ad esempio, considera avere uno stipendio alto come il criterio più importante nella scelta dell’impiego, solo l’11% dei millennials attribuisce a questo elemento un valore così elevato. Viceversa, avere un lavoro denso di significato, in cui ci si possa sentire realizzati, è una priorità assoluta per il 30% dei millennials, ma sta a cuore solo all’11% dei seniores. In generale, poi, i millennials sono nati nell’era dell’economia collaborativa e della condivisione, mentre l’ideologia che ha accompagnato la crescita professionale dei seniores era basata su competizione e privilegi".

Un pezzo di Andrea Libero Carbone, via CheFare

Perché costruire beni pubblici collettivi ancorandosi a tecnologie crittografiche? La #blockchain consente di concepire delle “smart commons” in grado di evolvere, essere democratiche e decentralizzate allo stesso tempo, immuni ad attacchi di free rider o forme di appropriazione indebita, capaci di preservare le loro risorse nel lungo periodo tramite regole fissate al livello algoritmico.

posts.message:
خلص ال Black Friday وبفضل الله خرجنا منه محققين ارقام قياسية شديدة :D . اول حاجة اننا بعنا 4 ثرى دى برنترز فى اقل من اسبوع. المهتم بالمجال ده سواء من المصنعين او مبيعات هيبقى عارف ان الموضوع ده محصلش قبل كدا فمصر نتيجة ان السوق لسه جديد والبيع فيه تقيل جدا. الموضوع ده طمنا كتير وحبينا نطمن ال شغالين فالمجال معانا ونلفت نظر باقى الناس اللى بتفكر تدخل بس خايفة.
تانى حاجة بقى وهى دى الاهم وكانت لحظة منتظرين من زمان انها تحصل ونجرى عشان نشاركها معاكم هو اننا بعنا اول عشرة . احنا بدأنا مرحلة المبيعات تقريبا من اول السنة بالظبط وكان كل هدفنا ال شايفين انه ممكن يطلع صعب يحصل اننا نبيع 10 برنترات بس فى السنة دى. وعشان نحقق الموضوع ده عملنا #عرض_العشرة ونزلنا سعر البرنتر 2000 جنيه عن تمنها الاصلى عشان نقرب الحدود اكتر للناس ونشجعم يجربوا والحمد لله رغم ان الموضوع كان صعب وطويل وكان كتير فى احساس احباط بس فى النهاية حققنا هدفنا و #بعنا_اول_عشرة.
حبينا نفرحكم ونقول لكم شكرا على دعمكم ودعواتكم لينا دايما :)

اليوم العالمى للطباعة ثلاثية الابعاد بيتنظم لاول مرة فى العالم ومصر هتكون مشاركة فيه. الايفنت يوم 17 ديسمبر بجامعة الزقازيق. نتمنى انكم تتبسطوا فى اليوم ده
https://www.facebook.com/events/920048871416746/

comments.message:
Vegetarianism (and especially veganism) is not the "proper" way for humans to eat, regardless of what is said about our ancient ancestor's diets. If you look at traditional societies (non-Western societies) across the globe, like the Hunza, the Eskimos, the Sioux, the Gaelics, the Aborigines, the Ma'asai, etc, these people are all optimally healthy. For traditional societies the world over certain animal foods are sacred and revered for bestowing fertility, health, and robustness. Such foods as organ meats of fish and game animals, fish eggs, cream, butter, cheese, raw milk, crustaceans, bone marrow, and other sea animals like whales and seals are deemed necessary by the people who use them for giving expecting mothers a trouble-free gestation and birth, and for allowing kids and children to grow into perfect adults. These people have perfect eyes, perfect teeth (including wisdom teeth), and generally perfect bodies; that is to say they are "normal" by nature's standards. Furthermore, they accredit physical perfection to these animal foods. 

With permaculture and regenerative agriculture we can create and maintain environments for all our necessary foods, both plant and animal, and harvest sustainably.

posts.message:
Long post, some thoughts on the text of SB 539 Regulation of e-liquid

> "Tobacco product", for purposes of IC 7.1-3-18.5, means a product that
> (1) contains tobacco, including e-liquid (as defined by IC 7.1-7-2-8); and
> (2) is intended for human consumption

then
>Sec. 8. "E-liquid" means a substance that is:
>(1) intended to be vaporized and inhaled using a vapor pen; and
>(2) manufatured and sold in a refillable or unsealed container or any container larger than two (2) milliliters 

So you can mix the juice for cigalikes in a port-a-potty.

Permits will be accepted and issued until June 30, 2016.  A manufacturing permit is valid for 5 years.  Applications must include plans for construction and operation and demonstrate that the facility is

>(A) consistent with reasonable guidelines regarding clean room facilities and sterilization processes; and
>(B) capable of meeting all of the security requirements contained in this article

We all want our juice to be mixed in a clean environment.  I support ISO-9 for mixing, as we want sterile surfaces and low dust, but ISO-6 is pharmaceutical level and I suspect what this language is probably leading to.  That's a $60,000 clean room.  It's what our nicotine vendors probably should have, it's what you need when you're doing real chemistry.  But for mixing, I believe food-safe is what we need, and that's an ISO-9 clean room.

All of the security requirements...  they're weird.  Pretty sure it's about preventing some legal synthetic weed juice from hitting the head shops, but I'm not convinced it will stop any of that.  Nobody in the vaping community would do that anyway.

>(11) The manufacturer's security firm shall install a remotely monitored security system at the facility in areas where e-liquid is mixed, bottles, packaged, and stored.
>(12) The manufacturer's security firm shall install an exclusive high security key system that limits access to areas where e-liquid is mixed, bottled, packaged, and stored to authorized personnel only.

sounds kind of expensive, but I bet it's under $1500.

>(13) The manufacturer's facility must be subject to twenty-four (24) hour video recording with remote viewing capability in areas where e-liquid is mixed, bogttled, packaged, and stored.  The video recordings must be retained for at least thirty (30) days.

Sounds more expensive, simply because the remote monitoring and logging is an ongoing part of the service contract.  Pretty sure this is so the DEA can watch us to make sure we're not putting drugs in it.

>(14) The manufacturer must take reasonable steps to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to secured areas of the facility where e-liquid is mixed, bottled, and packaged.

So that Guido doesn't sneak in to put drugs in it?  I don't know.

>(15) The manufacturer must submit to random audits of the facility and the manufacturer's records by the commission.
>(16) The manufacturer must submit to random site visits by the commission.

It would be better if it was a vaping-related regulatory agency instead of IN's Alcohol and Tobacco commission, but whatever, audits make sense.

>(17) The manufacturer must own and control both the e-liquid manufacturing and bottling process.
>(18) The manufacturer or anyone having a financial interest in a manufacturer may not have been convicted of a felony or an offense involving moral turpitude or a controlled substance.

Hehe, I just did a google image search for turpitude.

This bill also criminalizes selling eliquid in Indiana that is not approved by the Indiana Alcohol & Tobacco commission, meaning anyone that didn't file, meet the reqs, and pay the money.  Selling out of state juice, assuming it didn't have the Indiana license, would be a class B infraction, worse than selling to a minor (class C).  There has been speculation that this may make the bill unconstitutional under the interstate commerce clause.

A great turnout at the Statehouse!  We have to get Indiana SB539 killed or DRASTICLY amended, the only people it's good for are big Pharma and big Tobacco.  And who among us really cares about their interests.

Root beer had finally dropped!  It took a long time to get this right.   The first recipes were based on birch, but the final one actually has none at all.  Bringing citric acid into play was a game changer, and finally the proportions are just right.  If you like root beer, you have to try this.

posts.message:
Last week was an exciting week as I spent 4 days at Open Source Ecology with Marcin Jakubowski, Catarina Mota and 30 other participants in building a large integrated, modular aquaponics system (http://opensourceecology.org/aquaponic-greenhouse-workshop/) .  Open Source Aquaponics supplied the fish and assorted plants to get the greenhouse green and the nitrogen cycling started asap.  
For the scope of the project and number of people involved it went remarkably well and I had the privilege of making new friends from all over the U.S.A. and Quebec Canada.  The people were by far my favorite part of the trip and I look forward to collaborating more with Marcin and others from the workshop.

Made some major changes to the greenhouse!  Ripped out old tanks and installed new tank with cedar wood and Dura-Skrim liner.  Also added first 55 gallon barrel and set up settling tank, siphon system, wall insulation, extra layer of poly around the outside and more.  It's been a busy busy Fall!! ;)

I removed some leaking troughs from the north side and added a new tank made from premium materials this time... Cedar wood with a Dura-skrim liner.  Troughs will go back on top and above to create a nice flowing system.

I love how some plants have a knack growing into Art.
The spatial organization of this small plant is all natural. ;)
Strawberries from below... they are sooo good fresh and year-round too! :)
Greenhouse is cleaned up inside and plants look very healthy and happy again!   We've already been eating strawberries and a few goldenberries with many more on the way!  Love Spring!!

Are you interested in sustainable living?  
Here's my friend Dan Willis' dome project showing how it can be done with advanced understanding of how geometry affects energetic systems.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wslB1TQ2nUE
More info on his project can be seen here...
http://www.dreamhillresearch.com/dome/index.htm

posts.message: An overview of my open source greenhouse project with discussion of fish ranching, reusing kitchen scraps and worm composting.

Saved some green onion roots from the store a few weeks back and simply put them in the flow out in the greenhouse.  These pics are from two days later...
Currently they're a foot tall and ready to harvest again.

I love Spring.  The increased sunlight has really triggered the plants to turn on... especially the strawberries!  Two months ago they looked like they were all dying away, then suddenly they all "spring" back to life!

I've been using a Curcumin supplement (an extract from turmeric known for anti-inflammatory properties (works as good or better than ibuprofen for me) but I like the idea of growing my own medicine. Added to the list.
http://livingtraditionally.com/how-to-grow-your-own-turmeric-it-is-far-better-than-buying-it/

Know your sources!  Reading the document this guy submitted (and was accepted) is quite funny as it's basically non-sensical past the title and abstract.  It was accepted by 17 medical "Journals" with not a single real review.  It is because of things like these that I prefer to do a lot of my own research and take everything with a grain of salt until I find sources I can trust.

posts.message:
[DENTISTA? ECCO IL LIBRO PRATICO E SEMPLICE PER TROVARE NUOVI PAZIENTI]

Cosa c’entra il marketing con l’ odontoiatria? Questa e’ la domanda che centinaia di dentisti ci hanno posto negli ultimi anni e questa e’ la ragione per cui nasce questo libro.

L’evoluzione della professione odontoiatrica, passata dall’ essere appannaggio di pochi all’ essere la scelta di tanti, impone un ampliamento delle conoscenze del dentista: perchè oggi NON BASTA PIU' essere dei maghi delle cure canalari ma bisogna anche comprendere le regole base del marketing per far conoscere i propri servizi al più vasto pubblico possibile.

Perchè la verità è che oggi marketing e odontoiatria si tengono per mano e percorrono la stessa strada: quella del bene del paziente e del successo del dentista.

Dental Marketing NON è un manuale filosofico ma è un TESTO PRATICO. E’ ricco di case history, esempi pratici e consigli semplici da attuare per promuovere uno studio dentistico. Non è destinato ad esperti di marketing ma all’ odontoiatra chi si voglia approcciare con successo al marketing finalizzato a trovare nuovi pazienti e fidelizzare quelli già esistenti

Richiedi subito il libro all'indirizzo http://www.paoloruggeri.it/shop.asp?idp=98

comments.message: Oriana Streni dottorè

Cazzate! Potete comunicare quello che volete, avrete sempre quello che non rientra  negli schemi. Le low cost macinano un numero di prestazioni odontoiatriche che uno studio privato se le sogna. E lo fa in maniera costante da anni , nonostante che i colleghi fuori da questi circuito critichino e mettano" ingiustificatamente " in guardia i loro pazienti. Ciò che conta è la qualità percepita..... È questo non va assolutamente bene , perché non corrisponde alla qualità erogata !!! Le low cost hanno in funzione dei grandi numeri di prestazione una intera popolazione all'esterno di aventi goduto cure, e questa popolazione è' incontrollabile ,e racconta agli         altri  la sua esperienza che può essere negativa o positiva , ma non necessariamente perché lo è stata veramente ..... Ma solo perché le sue aspettative sono state esaudite o no!! Il peggio è che a fronte di un numero così elevato di pazienti trattati , spesso al bar , o alle poste , esiste l'alta probabilità che due persone si incontrino e si scambino la loro esperienza maturata nell'ambito della stessa struttura. E voi sapete che delle cose buone..... Percepite....... Si parla poco, delle cose cattive ..... Percepite, .....se ne parla molto , e questo amplifica la probabilità che di una struttura non se ne parli positivamente . Però , si c'è un però: nonostante queste dinamiche le strutture complesse non perdono i pazienti ..... Gli studi convenzionali invece si!!!! E sapete perché? Noi possiamo fare quello che vogliamo , inventarci ciò che ci pare ( front Office straordinarie, padiglioni grandi luminosi ed attrezzature le più moderne) ma il paziente decide in base sempre al suo percepito che è reale o falsato dalla sua cultura , psicologia , ma soprattutto dalla necessità di spendere il meno possibile. La professione e' stata consegnata nelle mani della gente comune , e questa fa ciò che vuole, a volte sembra che si abbia trovato il modo di incanalarla, ma dura poco. Il vero errore e mistificazione sta nel fatto che il cittadino è' stato bombardato e viene bombardato  sulla necessità delle cure odontoiatriche come se dovesse fare un vaccino obbligatoriamente ...... Ma alla fin fine purtroppo per molta gente, quando si profilano preventivi da affrontare sopra i mille euro , comincia ad entrare in difficoltà  e quindi cerca il risparmio.'mettiamocelo in testa il vero problema  è che tutti non possono o non vogliono affrontare certe spese. Quindi la dinamica della libera professione e' irreversibilmente compromessa: alti costi di esercizio , pletora di offerta, basso costo può anche significare bassa qualità..... Ma questo è più vero per lo studio tradizionale , quando cerca di adattarsi al mercato, che per le low cost . Buona giornata
X te Federica Di Sabatino...

posts.message:
I'm going to be doing cost analysis on each of these components and providing price comparisons and total expenses so people can get a better idea for how much components will cost to built and function.

I'm going to split it into 2 groups: Building Costs, and Cost of Production (aka Marginal Costs).  Building Cost will be the cost of building the system.  Marginal Cost will be the on-going cost to actually run the system and produce food.

Right now, I'm growing lettuce and spinach in the grow bed, 3 goldfish in the tank, and 4 strong LED panels - everything is growing great!

The last part of the system (The Automated Larvae Harvester) is all that's left; which would complete the closed loop of:
Organic waste -> Automated Larvae Harvester -> Food for fish -> Nutrients for plants -> Food to eat -> back to organic waste.... all without money or any external input.
